website_summaries.verdict: This model boasts an energy-efficient standby mode, and the unit manages to be fairly compact while still producing a surprising 121 decibels.
pros: For users who need a unit that will fit in a smaller space while still producing sound big enough to fill an average living room, this model is a good option
The powerful 500 watt amp reaches output of almost 121 decibels, and the 12 in
driver reproduces frequencies down to 18 Hz, all without any distortion to disrupt the sound experience
The sealed cabinet is stable and does not vibrate even at high volumes
The unit will switch automatically into standby mode when not in use, consuming less than .5 watts of power
cons: Users who enjoy bass heavy music such as rap or electronic music may prefer a ported cabinet, which produces more booming bass

customer_reviews.title: Overrated and unimpressive
customer_reviews.text: Weak and disappointing sub. For "500W" and $700 I expected much more. I've had a few different Polk Audio subs the most recent being a $200 PSW12 and it was far louder and about the same as far as sound quality. I'm using both subs together now with 3 pairs of ELAC Uni-Fi UB5 speakers. Another problem I'm having is a loud noise when the sub comes out of standby. Usually its just a loud buzz sound but occasionally its an even louder and startling squeal. I bought this sub expecting a tighter and cleaner sound over the ported subs I've used before but I can't say there's any improvement in sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Markscreename

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: Longtime audiophile, have had many subwoofers and dedicated systems. Had an SVS subwoofer in a dedicated home theater room in my last house that was amazing. Bought this one to pair with 2 B&W 803 Nautilus that we use with our TV and Sonos/Tidal. Followed the simple setup instructions and even my wife was impressed with how seamless it paired with they system and how good it sounded with music, movies and TV. Thanks again SVS for making a sub that is going to bring years of listening pleasure to our house, at a budget even my spouse can agree with!
customer_reviews.author: M. Yonan

customer_reviews.title: Incredible. Look at nothing else.
customer_reviews.text: OK, this subwoofer is INSANE. I've had a ton of experience with everything from Sony to JBL to Klipsch to Polk. I also rarely write reviews if that says anything. NOTHING comes close to the quality at this price point. This rattles our entire house without a blip in sound quality. Take this sucker down below 25 Hz and you FEEL it. Explosions, music, subtle moments, anything. Use with phase matching and it makes it even crazier. This is literally the perfect sub and I'll likely be purchasing one or two more in the coming months to outfit my basement and master bedroom system. Wow wow wow. Don't look at anything else. Just buy this.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bonfield

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a keeper.
customer_reviews.text: I am 70/30 music/movies guy and it delivers in every aspect. Bass is tight and accurate. Now I want another one! If you are reading this, you should already know that this product presents fantastic price-to-performance ratio. If installing on hardwood floors, be sure to get SVS isolation system. Not a big fan of metal grill and blue led, so I covered it up.
customer_reviews.author: Styler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sound for small to medium rooms that hits like a freight-train.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing subwoofer! I have this in an 8'x12' room with a door to a 12'x14' room. I am running it through a JDS Labs OL DAC and then out through the subwoofers 80hz crossover line-outs to a pair of Vanatoo Transparent One bookshelf speakers. After balancing everything with Room EQ Wizard and a, the speakers and subwoofer blend wonderfully. Even having the volume turned down for background music, the subwoofer is still able to produce clean, accurate, tight bass. Adding a little extra bass for movies produces intense, hard-hitting effects. With the subwoofer on anstand, even though the sound slams you in the room, you hardly notice it throughout the rest of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Ari Ritchie

customer_reviews.title: Crazy good
customer_reviews.text: After reading dozens of reviews, both on Amazon and the web, almost all overwhelmingly positive, I pulled the trigger and bought it. Nobody I read had lied. This thing is all I had hoped it would be. I’m driving it with a Denon that has Audessey calibration. Words like smooth, tight, punchy are the desciptors I’m using. Boomy only applies when the sounds is supposed to be boomy! Think a bomb. This is an even better value as it seems the SB-2000 was discounted $100!
customer_reviews.author: J. Price

customer_reviews.title: Not good to grill
customer_reviews.text: As far as performance goes, I echo the praises of other reviewers. However, the curved and projecting metal grill has got to go. It's unsightly and sticks out far too much. The SB1000 sub features the usual cloth/fabric cover for the front. This is what I would prefer. Yet, inexplicably, SVS says it's somehow not available on the (only slightly larger) SB2000!
customer_reviews.author: M. Lisowski

customer_reviews.title: Changed my Life
customer_reviews.text: I know that seems hyperbolic... but, I'm a music lover and thought I could get away with powered (sub) tower fronts. I was wrong. I have GoldenEar Triton 3's powered by an Anthem amp. Not a bad set-up. I lived with that for a few years until I decided to find a sub. After a lot of research and conversations, I settled on the SVS-2000. Lord have mercy! This thing is a monster. Allowed the speakers to shine and added some effortless tight low end. I also upgraded cables to BJ (Blue Jean cables - awesome at a good price). Sub is expensive but highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: AudioIdiot

customer_reviews.title: The bass is very articulate and sounds great in my medium size room
customer_reviews.text: @35lbs 12 inch speakers this subwoofer defies logic. The bass is very articulate and sounds great in my medium size room. If quality is what you are looking for no other in this price range compares.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio C.

customer_reviews.title: Verify the integrity of your home with this handy earthquake simulator
customer_reviews.text: Me: sets everything up and plays some random DJ mix. Sub: does cool stuff, sounds great. DJ mix: hits a drop and pumps a bass-line so low the sound-waves go backwards. Sub: turns the whole room into a slow-mo scene from the first Matrix, ruptures three of my internal organs, and probably takes 50 years off the life of my house. DJ mix: goes back to normal. Me: slowly turns and asks my dog if he peed himself too. 10/10 - will happily pee myself again in a collapsing building, and so should you.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Westerman

customer_reviews.title: Great Sub, shakes the whole block house if I let it
customer_reviews.text: Its my first Sub, im running it with a Denon 2400, and Martin Logan motion series 5.1 surround sound system. It deffinately provides some serious bass in a 15x20 feet living room, with a open floor plan that has a kitchen attatched adding 18x10 feet to the room. I didnt even do a Sub crawl, mainly because I only had 1 available spot for the sub, so it didnt matter. Deffinately happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle A. Kliamovich

customer_reviews.title: Great subwoofer! Clear and powerful!
customer_reviews.text: SVS subwoofers are the best! I bought a ported 12" SVS sub a couple of years ago and was so impressed I bought this non-ported 12" when I needed one for another room. Solidly built and looks good! Strong low frequency bass that you can feel and will rattle the house if you crank it up. I've used them in rooms up to 15x23 feet. Very clear, no distortion, even when pushed to the limit, provides true audiophile level sound. The sub also has circuitry in it to protect the driver from overload damage. Worth the extra cost over "cheaper" subwoofers.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Tight Base!
customer_reviews.text: I have Mini Maggies, SMGa’s. I always wanted a little more kick especially because I use them for movies too. I drive them with a NAD AV-716. I’m used to the tight base Magnepan speakers provide. This sealed sub matches well with them. I love the compact size. The base is clean powerful and tight. I tend to turn up the speaker for movies and tone it down slightly for music. I love this sub!
customer_reviews.author: John Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Pure Awesomeness!
customer_reviews.text: Best sub I've heard in a long time! I installed it in the ceiling with a sound tube. Rocks the entire great room like a dance club. Response is outrageous! I have to run it with the power turned down significantly as to not over power all of the other speakers in my 7.1 system. Great problem to have!
customer_reviews.author: Mattman

customer_reviews.title: Your neighbors will call you Thumper
customer_reviews.text: When I tell you this thing thumps, it thumps! Great for music but use mostly for watching movies. My tried and true test is always the first appearance of the T-Rex in the original Jurassic Park... my poor dogs ran out of the room! Not just loud, but great quality too. I'm not an audiophile but this sub is great.
customer_reviews.author: meh

customer_reviews.title: Very easy integration
customer_reviews.text: Two channel stereo is still alive. Great sealed sub for music. It has great integration controls, and is very quick and tight. Not so much for a large room however. A good extension to the low end of your towers. Not a big bass sound source. It hides nicely. Build quality seems good. No rattles or air leaks upon testing. Now the fun begins. The fine tuning...
customer_reviews.author: Jomach

customer_reviews.title: Clean floor smashing power!
customer_reviews.text: This is a absolutely awesome subwoofer. It has a sophisticated DSP system which optimizes the bass all the way down.......and it does go surprisingly low for a sealed enclosure. It is built like a tank as well. Even the metal grill weighs a couple pounds in itself. If you want the best possible sound quality for music then this is your sub. If you want higher spl and boomy, sloppy bass then get a vented home theater subwoofer. This one specializes in musical accuracy. I highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: DirtyD

customer_reviews.title: Incredible product with great customer service
customer_reviews.text: This is really an incredible sub, and I've had some sweet ones over the years. It lacks the mobile ap controls of the 3000, but if you can live without that convenience, its the way to go for the money. I did have a technical glitch initially but SVS customer service resolved it fast, and I mean fast. Very good experience and glad I made the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Piper

customer_reviews.title: Love this sub!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to round out the sub-40Hz frequencies for my system. I'm pairing it with Kef Q750s and an Arcam SR250. It sounds fantastic. I'm in a 800sf 1-bed and this has plenty of juice, and the volume adjustment means I can ensure it's not overpowering.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Great small sub.
customer_reviews.text: I have this in a 12x14 room. This EASILY pressurizes the room and goes plenty deep. It is fast, musical, and blends well with my system . It replaced an old, small Paradigm sub which did none of these. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: chris williamson

customer_reviews.title: Dynamic Subwoofer.
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely astounded by this sub. Despite it's relatively small footprint and sealed cabinet, this beasts 12 inch driver and sledge amplifier shocked me with it's raw power and lack of distortion. I watched a couple of my favorite action movies, and it was like watching them for the first time; I thought it was going to shake my building down. With a very solid cabinet and intuitive, easy to understand connections, I highly recommend this subwoofer to anyone that wants a compact sub with performance meeting or exceeding that of much larger subs four or five times it's price.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Clean sub ..but you may need two
customer_reviews.text: This is my second SB 2000, both used in a single stereo configuration in a medium size room at moderate listening levels. The unit sounds very clean and accurate ( I use this system for music only). A single unit seems to be a bit shy on its clean output capability. Using a sound pressure meter to set up the units, I found a single subwoofer pushed into distortion when its level was raised to achieve balance . Once the second unit was added everything sounds excellent. By the way the vendor (SVS) , recommends dual subwoofer configurations
customer_reviews.author: harry

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a month, replaced without any questions. Sounds Great!
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a month then stopped reproducing bass. Seller agreed to replace without question- I emailed SVS and they agreed to repair/replace if the seller did not. I would recommend SVS for that alone, but the sub sounds great also. Bass can shake the walls if I turn it up.
customer_reviews.author: lok777

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and a solid performer.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sub. Powerful and good with music of all kinds. Great value now that it’s on sale. This model has been superseded by the 2000 Pro, which sports some technical improvements that are probably not noticeable. Lacks equalization...need to get that from your preamp-processor.
customer_reviews.author: Donald C Shapero

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: I had what I thought was a great subwoofer in my home theater system before I bought this. No way once I got this set up properly it was very evident that the movies and music I listen are clearer cleaner with well defined bass notes not just bass sound. Awesome
customer_reviews.author: Dale R. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Fast deep bass at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed at the quality of this boomer! Big, deep, fast bass compliments my ultrafast electrostatic speakers perfectly. A great buy!
customer_reviews.author: T. Pariseau

customer_reviews.title: Best sub I might ever have
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best sub. Theater quality bass in games, big jeep like bass in my music. Upgraded from a Polk Audio 10 inch to this. Greatest investment i ever made as far as entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: Violent J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Holy Moly!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is "WOW!!!!" Added this SVS SB-2000 subwoofer to my 7.1 home theater setup to replace a cheaper 15" sub. All I can say is buy this thing now! Unbelievably accurate bass response that will shake you (and your house) to the core. I'll likely add a second sub for a complete 7.2 system down the road. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wilken

customer_reviews.title: Wow!! This sub is awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sub!! Replaced my Defintive ProSub 1000, this shakes my house like a much bigger sub! Excellent sound quality for music, great sub!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice
customer_reviews.text: Not as powerful of output as I had hoped. Perhaps the vented version would have been better. Great appearance.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gates

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sub!
customer_reviews.text: Added the SB2000 to my Klipsch RP280F speakers, it increased the bass depth significantly. Sound quality is great, rumbles the floor with bass, but is not boomy in the slightest. I will one day add another one to my system.👍
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Affordable High End Audio
customer_reviews.text: Oh boy. Glue the Knick knacks down. Really nice tight and LOW bass response. There’s no hiding this. If you have neighbors, they’re going to have bass too.
customer_reviews.author: Geneflem

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and size for our 14X14X12 TV room.
customer_reviews.text: We replaced a dying 200W 10" subwoofer which was always wanting for those intense earthshaking movie scenes. So it was time to replace and upgrade. We have had the The SVS SB2000 for a month now and can say it has great crisp bass and "power" margin to spare for our setup. Quite pleased and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D. Puchaty

customer_reviews.title: Solid bass for your setup
customer_reviews.text: Very good addition to my speaker system. Bass extension is excellent, the sound is great. Paired with Infinity Reference series.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Trojanowski

customer_reviews.title: Clean and accurate
customer_reviews.text: You don't hear low notes, you hear each sharp thump of the drums, vibrations of bass strings, as loud or soft as you want. Well worth the upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonium Rex

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have this in my 30 x 24 sunroom and wow... All around good, clean, accurate bass. Works well with both movies and music. I was kind of on the fence about shelling out the cash on this compared to just getting a good $200 - $300 range sub feel like I made the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: ...all I can say is BOOOOM!
customer_reviews.text: Got my SB-2000 yesterday and tuned it today, all I can say is BOOOOM...it’s awesome!
customer_reviews.author: just review it!

customer_reviews.title: The bestest boom boom box
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels very sturdy. It easily shakes my windows and picks up very low frequencies.. Only thing better than its looks is its performance.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Porter

customer_reviews.title: SVS SB2000 is worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the sub hooked up and calibrated to your receiver, this sub definitely delivers to the depths everybody raves about! Only thing, SVS should be including the subwoofer feet WITH the sub given the purchase price. The feet help the whole overall sound of the sub be more precise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best  Subwoofers I have had.
customer_reviews.text: Great price, fast shipping and absolutely the best subwoofers i have ever heard.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great Build Integrity
customer_reviews.text: Appearance is appealing. No issues and plays nicely with other non-SVS sub.
customer_reviews.author: David Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound quality, I chose this after researching many reviews and have been very satisfied. It has the pure bass volume and power without distortion you'd get from cheaper subwoofers.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sub
customer_reviews.text: This is my second sub and it’s awesome the bass is unbelievable very happy the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: javier miranda

customer_reviews.title: Well hard earned money spent...😛
customer_reviews.text: I like everything... sound is great with crossover control... what I like most is the metal grille cover... when on the floor and not in use, it gives solid protection from accidental bumps... material is solid too...
customer_reviews.author: Robert O.

customer_reviews.title: Great sub
customer_reviews.text: This sub really helped my Kef T301 system with low end bass. Great price point for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Damian S. Guelakis

customer_reviews.title: Flawless
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for music lovers. Does an amazing job with home theater also.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best subwoofer for the money!! I liked the first one I bought so well that I bought a second one for my system and it is doubly sweet sounding. Has that crisp, clean, deep sound. No muddiness, no flubby sound just pure sweetness. Be sure to have your system set up by someone who knows how to set up your system so all of your speakers are not walking all over each other.
customer_reviews.author: bluesjunky2

customer_reviews.title: wont dissappoint
customer_reviews.text: really does hit low 20hz and hits clean with authority
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: SVS are premium products at consumer prices.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. The sound for price and footprint is unbelievable. I am ready to get another one for stereo bass.
customer_reviews.author: NEWKIRK

customer_reviews.title: Bang (literally)for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: This sub thumps like a champ! With volume to boot! (svs sb-2000), I recommend the svs isolation pads,. They definitely help with vibrations.
customer_reviews.author: M.C

customer_reviews.title: Get the sound isolation feet, work better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding, started with one of these bad boys, I now have 3, can’t go wrong here folks.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best for the dollar.
customer_reviews.text: Takes whatever you throw at it.I had a tower when SVS first started. This is tighter, smaller but just as deep.
customer_reviews.author: W. C. W.

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced, excellent quality.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and adjust to blend into current sound system. Produces quality, non-obtrusive base.
customer_reviews.author: RJF

customer_reviews.title: SVS SB-2000
customer_reviews.text: Great Subwoofer for movies and music it’s better than my old sub m&k 350..
customer_reviews.author: Kk

customer_reviews.title: The SVS SB 2000 is brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Great enhancement to my system. The sub has transformed the sound of my other speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Svs 2000
customer_reviews.text: The bass is very deep sounds awesome great addition to my system
customer_reviews.author: jaime s. osorio

customer_reviews.title: I love this subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: This subwoofer totally blew me away! Setting up the sub was much easier than I thought, from opening the box to having it thump was about 10 minutes. once I had the dials set in, i was in heaven. I'm using a peachtree nova 65 se and q300 speakers for music, and this sub gets all the notes the q300 doesn't and in my opinion completes the sound. I would highly recommend this sub for music, and the ported for movies.
customer_reviews.author: Jino

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sub, room is 25x20 and this is plenty
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sub, room is 25x20 and this is plenty, I only use it on 1/2 to 3/4 volume and it shakes the house two stories up :) just what I wanted
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Deep and clear bass that fills the room without distortion. I love the sound. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Flores da Cunha

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Stunning performance from a small package. I will be buying another very soon
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Everything I hoped it would be
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a home theater set up, an older Definitive Technology Pro100 set of speakers. I replaced the old sub with this one, and the difference is startling. Music, in particular, is much better defined. In my 20 by 16 room movie sound is also spectacular. I listened to Master and Commander (my test for a sub) and the first battle scene was satisfyingly loud and exciting. The sealed sub will never have the chest thumping presence of a ported sub, but the sound for films is more than satisfying, and the sound for music is outstanding. Highly recommended, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Truly outstanding
customer_reviews.text: This sub clearly should be a top choice for those who want super firm low end and demand accurate reproduction for all genres of music. I should also add that the factory was very helpful in assisting tweek the settings. They are first rate!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Ewald

customer_reviews.title: Even though this SB2000 is only about 12" but it does better then my old huge 15" sub
customer_reviews.text: Tight, deep, clean bass. Even though this SB2000 is only about 12" but it does better then my old huge 15" sub. Sounds great for both music and movies.
customer_reviews.author: mn

customer_reviews.title: Hits Hard
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and it sits in a large open room. Plenty of sub even for a pretty big space.4000 cubic feet or so. My last sub was a velodyne spl1000 sealed with 1000 watts rms and this is every bit of that sub for half the price. Great sub.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Seriously though it's a great sub. I teamed it up with a Dynamo ...
customer_reviews.text: It takes your mom to pound town. Seriously though it's a great sub. I teamed it up with a Dynamo 700 and sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: kook

customer_reviews.title: Best performance for the money!
customer_reviews.text: No subwoofer will give you better performance for the money!
customer_reviews.author: tyler

customer_reviews.title: The Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: VERY pleased with this inexpensive sub-woofer. So much better than the boomers and bangers.
customer_reviews.author: Inconspicuous

customer_reviews.title: but I have to say that this is one of the finest decisions I've ever made
customer_reviews.text: After my Paradigm PW2200 died after many years of faithful service, I researched long and hard and decided to replace it with two of the SVS SB2000's. And I have to say, I'm absolutely thrilled with this decision. The subs are tight, accurate and deep. I had a slight moment of fear when I went from one to two subs, but I have to say that this is one of the finest decisions I've ever made. Love the SVS SB2000 (running them with a Yamaha Aventage 2030 and Paradigm Studio Series speakers).
customer_reviews.author: T. F. Shumosic

customer_reviews.title: Don't Delay, Buy the Subwoofer!
customer_reviews.text: Completely satisfied! I was always a straight stereo guy who thought subwoofers were superfluous if you had decent speakers. I found out a few years ago I was wrong. Towers won't work in my room, but I have some some high quality bookshelf speakers with great bass for their size. When I got my first sub, I was stunned with the change. I just added the SB2000 and couldn't be more pleased. I highly recommend the SVS, but there are plenty of really good subs in this price range. Don't hold out like me, buy one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H.

customer_reviews.title: Great sub from SVS
customer_reviews.text: Great sub from SVS , unfortunately it wasn't the sub for me.... Tight and clean may be the choice for some people , but I am more of a loud and in your face type sub....this is not that sub....if you get enough of them , I'm sure the decibels will get there , but I am more than happy with the SVS pc2000...it gives me what "I" need....For people that like sealed subs , you will probably love it , for people like me , a ported SVS sub will give all you need and more......
customer_reviews.author: Ben lozolla

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This sub unit looks good, and it really performs. Excellent value for money. It sounds wonderful. Accordingly I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: W. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect, unlike other powered subs in this price range
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a while now,no issues. I use it for playing records hooked up to a marantz receiver. Works well in my small room. I hope to acquire another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Robinson

product_meta.title: SVS SB-2000 Subwoofer (Black Ash) – 12-inch Driver, 500-Watts RMS, Sealed Cabinet
product_meta.description: The SB-2000 subwoofer delivers an unbeatable combination of low frequency extension, room energizing power, lightning-fast transients and musical accuracy from a compact cabinet measuring only 14-inches all around.
feature_bullets: The SVS SB-2000 Subwoofer combines power, quickness, intelligent processing, and innovative driver design to deliver an unrivaled bass experience for music, movies, TV and everything you listen to
Dimension: 14.6-Inch H x 14.2-Inch W x 15.4-Inch D
Driver : 12-Inch ; The Sledge STA-500D is the sonic engine that brings an unprecedented amp technology and sophistication
Amplifier : 500 watts rms (1100 watts peak) ; Frequency Response : 19-220 hz ±3 DB
Standby mode with less than 0.5 watts consumption ; sealed box subwoofer.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars177 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
